II. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
III. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• It was discussed the development of an electronic file system, and the facility
suggested they are in the process of developing such a system and hope to have
it completed within the next year.
• It was discussed with the facility the need to ensure their compliance person is
activity involved in reviewing the rules on a regular basis.
IV. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The facility asked for information on trainings for social service workers to be
trained on the development of treatment plans. Several trainings were pointed out
along with individuals who have the ability to help support the facility in the
development of a training.
V. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The CAP was in response to the 2023 Renewal Inspection. As noted in the Chief
Administrator report, after a few adjustments in the process of developing the
treatment plan and updating it as required, the facility has reached a point where
there were no issues during this inspection with the treatment plans. Objectives
changes and were documented in the progress or lack of progress in the treatment
plan. The facility fully understands the need to continue to follow with the changes
they have made.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
2

PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The CA identified there were no special investigations with the facility during the
past year. The only CAP over the past year was obtained in the renewal inspection
and involved treatment plans not being updated to address new issues. The facility
has followed through with the CAP and even made adjustments to the CAP in an
effort to be successful. A new Social Service worker was hired, and this individual
has undergone training to ensure there is solid understanding of the method to
develop and update treatment plans. The facility developed a check list to ensure
the oversite was covering the areas that needed improvement and to ensure staff
are collecting appropriate information. The checklist was found to not being
implemented appropriately and the CA is in the process of updating the checklist
and developing a system of ensure it is used appropriately.
Staff and Youth Interviews
All of the staff interviewed were very positive and believed administration was very
supportive of their efforts to provide best practice to the youth they serve. Each also
reported receiving adequate training and that administration takes a proactive
approach to problems identified and possible problems.
Only a limited number of youth (2) were verbal, and their understanding of
questions was very limited. The interactions between staff and youth were
observed and all interactions were therapeutic in nature and very respectful of the
youth.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The facility is in very good condition and well maintained. Fire extinguishers are up
to date and all plumbing is in working order. Bedrooms are appropriately furnished.
The menu was present and there was an appropriate amount of food available.
Medications were under a double lock system and all necessary and required
postings were in place.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
